article.label: DANIEL FINKELSTEIN | COMMENT

attributes.value: At last, a real Tory budget. This was how sections of the press and right-wing commentators on social media greeted Kwasi

article.headline: There’s a good Tory case for raising taxes

attributes.value: At last, a real Tory budget. This was how sections of the press and right-wing commentators on social media greeted Kwasi Kwarteng’s measures. And even before the whole thing collapsed ignominiously, the reaction did make me wonder.

The headlines seemed to prompt a question: how did they know? How did they know the mini-budget was a real Tory one? I mean, if Kwarteng was doing something Tories rarely do, perhaps it was his budget that wasn’t really Tory, rather than the entire history of the Tory party.

The assertion that his measures were truly Tory seemed to suggest there is some sort of checklist of “real” Tory policies, a set of Tory commandments that almost nobody actually consults. Until the new prime minister found a
Daniel Finkelstein

attributes.value: The Duchess of Sussex has told how being a “briefcase girl” on the American version of
Deal or No Deal
made her feel “objectified” as a bimbo.
Despite being grateful for the work as a struggling actress, being valued for her beauty and not her brains made her feel “not smart” and she ended up quitting the gameshow.
Speaking with Paris Hilton in the latest episode of her
Archetypes
podcast
, called Breaking Down the Bimbo, the duchess said that she wanted her daughter Lilibet to be valued first for her brain rather than her body.
She said: “I want our daughter to aspire to be slightly higher. Yeah, I want my Lili to want to be educated and want to be smart and to

article.strapline: Ex-minister warns of economic pain to come
article.headline: Ousting Liz Truss a matter of when not if, says Michael Gove

attributes.value: Michael Gove has said it is a matter of when not if Liz Truss is removed as prime minister as he warned Britons to expect “a hell of a lot of pain in the next two months”.
The former cabinet minister, who backed Rishi Sunak in the summer and was an early opponent of Truss’s mini-budget, said that her programme had now been “shredded”.
Could Liz Truss be forced to resign?
Who could replace Liz Truss as prime minister?
At a private event today
Gove

said that “we are going through hell” and “after hell comes purgatory and paradise”. He added: “Purgatory is going to be a tough economic medicine applied in this country and elsewhere. For how long I don’t know. But

attributes.value: When Sir Graham Brady strides down Westminster corridors you feel there should be a musical accompaniment of fourth-valve euphonium. The full-bottomed Brady is a parpy sort of fellow, a one-time baby of the Conservative benches who has matured into a richly seasoned grandee.
Were he a yacht his galley would gleam, the decks would be scrubbed daily and there would be a large brass bell to summon matelots to morning parade.
Commodore Brady runs a tight ship.
The last three prime ministers have possibly viewed Brady less as a sailor and more as an undertaker. Chairing the
1922 Committee
, Brady measures backbench Conservative dissent. It is gluey Graham whose thick-sausage fingers count the letters expressing lack of confidence in a leader. And what letters

attributes.value: Perched on a rocky outcrop overlooking mountains and gorges, the tiny village of Siurana in northern Spain fended off invaders for centuries.
Its craggy charm, however, which has been depicted by artists such as Joan Miró, has now placed it under the threat of what its mayor calls an excess of tourism
. To protect it, he has refused an invitation to have the village listed as one of Spain’s most beautiful.
Salvador Salvadó, the mayor of Siurana, which has a population of only 27 and lies in the
Priorat area
of the Catalonia region, has said the decision was made by the local council.
“Mass tourism does not bring any good,” he said. “We don’t have the capacity to absorb more people. We never

article.headline: Catalan village of Siurana refuses to join Spain’s ‘most beautiful’ list

attributes.value: Isambard Wilkinson, Madrid

article.shortHeadline: Catalan village refuses to join Spain’s ‘most beautiful’ list

attributes.value: To many observers, including sometimes the man himself, the rise and rise of James Corden has been a marvel as he stepped effortlessly on to steadily grander stages, on Broadway, in Hollywood, and as the host of a late-night talk show.

But there is at least one place in the United States where Corden’s presence has not always been welcomed and that is at Balthazar in SoHo, New York — the brasserie and celebrity haven owned by the London-born restaurant proprietor Keith McNally.

McNally declared that he was banning Corden in a message on his Instagram page, which he uses to publish reports from his restaurant managers and to take the occasional pot-shot at a patron who has offended him.
James Corden
is a

article.label: politics
article.headline: Jeremy Hunt’s great mea culpa could mean £5,000 fuel bills

attributes.value: Families are facing average energy bills of up to £5,000 from April after Liz Truss was forced to rip up her government’s entire economic strategy and
issue a public apology to the nation

Jeremy Hunt, the new chancellor, said that the energy price guarantee which limits average energy bills to £2,500, will come to an end in April. Support will then be targeted at the most vulnerable in a move that could see bills for most families double.
Today the head of National Grid warned households to prepare for blackouts between 4pm and 7pm on “really, really cold” weekdays in January and February in light of reduced gas imports from Europe.
Hunt also reversed £32 billion worth of tax cuts from Truss’s
disastrous mini-budget
Steven Swinford
, Political Editor |
Oliver Wright
, Policy Editor |
Henry Zeffman
, Associate Political Editor

article.shortHeadline: Hunt’s great mea culpa could mean £5,000 fuel bills

attributes.value: Ben Wallace has said that he wants to remain defence secretary amid speculation he could be a unity candidate if Liz Truss departs.
Wallace said he believed Truss should carry on to ensure stability at a time of heightened threats and economic turmoil.
He did not stand for prime minister in the summer but has been touted in recent days as a candidate should Truss be forced out. His handling of Ukraine has driven up his popularity ratings.

Wallace, a former Scots Guard, told The Times that he wanted to keep his job and rebuked his Conservative colleagues for playing “political parlour games”. He said: “The public wants stability and security and if the government fails to deliver that then they will send us into

attributes.value: The Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka has picked up the Booker prize in London, but only after the organisers had paid for his air fare.
Karunatilaka’s second adult novel,
The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida

, a noirish ghost story centring on a gay war photographer, was said by the chairman of judges to take readers on a “rollercoaster journey through life and death . . . to the dark heart of the world” where they would find “joy, tenderness, love and loyalty”.

Neil MacGregor added: “In scale it seemed to be greater than any of the others and in the variety of the registers deployed, the skills in which language was used, and the confidence with which it switched from noir to philosophical meditation

attributes.value: The largest outbreak of bird flu recorded in the UK has led to a “prevention zone” being declared across Britain, triggering
The largest outbreak of bird flu recorded in the UK has led to a “prevention zone” being declared across Britain, triggering legal requirements for all bird keepers to follow strict measures.
Since October last year, 190 cases of avian flu have been confirmed with 30 of these identified this month alone.
The east of England has been the worst hit area in
poultry and captive birds
, with new cases identified over the weekend in west and south Norfolk and mid-Suffolk. Another case was identified in Cheshire on Sunday.

The chief veterinary officers for England, Wales and Scotland have now declared an “avian influenza protection zone” (AIPZ) over all of Britain. This means keepers with more than 500 birds will have to restrict who can

article.headline: Bird flu outbreak leads to countrywide restrictions

attributes.value: Kaya Burgess
, Science Reporter

Netflix conman extradited over ‘hit and run’ on police

attributes.value: A British conman who once posed as an MI5 agent and is accused of trying to run over two French police officers was extradited from Belgium yesterday.
Robert Hendy-Freegard, 51, was handed over to police in France, where he is wanted on suspicion of attempted murder in August.

The officers were allegedly struck by his Audi A3 after they intervened at the isolated house in Vidaillat, a village in the Creuse département of central France, where he lived with Sandra Clifton, 49, his British partner.
Police had been called after Clifton’s son arrived to take her back to Britain, because he claimed she was being coercively controlled by
Hendy-Freegard
and forced to live a reclusive life.
After being told to accompany the officers to the
Adam Sage
, Paris

attributes.value: A senior ally of Penny Mordaunt held private talks with Rishi Sunak last week amid claims that they could strike a pact in

article.headline: Penny Mordaunt ally held talks with Rishi Sunak as No 10 turmoil grew

attributes.value: A senior ally of Penny Mordaunt held private talks with Rishi Sunak last week amid claims that they could strike a pact in the event that
Liz Truss is forced to resign
, The Times has been told.
The former chancellor was contacted by the ally of Mordaunt and discussed the “state of play” in the Conservative Party. One source claimed that there was a “tacit” suggestion that
Sunak could serve as chancellor in a Mordaunt government
, which was rebuffed by Sunak, who is refusing to entertain any discussions about removing Truss from office.
A second source acknowledged the conversation but said that there had been no formal offer. An ally of Sunak said: “Like everyone else Rishi wanted the party to come together
Steven Swinford
, Political Editor |
Geraldine Scott
, Political Reporter

article.label: Politics
article.shortHeadline: Mordaunt ally held talks with Sunak as No 10 turmoil grew

attributes.value: The new owners of George Michael’s £19 million home have won permission for extensive renovation work including a
The new owners of George Michael’s £19 million home have won permission for extensive renovation work including a “super-basement” after a planning battle with neighbours.
Some had opposed the plans, which they said risked adversely affecting “the harmony” of the area and would have a “derogatory” impact on “one of the finest rows of houses” on their street.
Stephen Cameron and his wife, Clare Harrison, who are said to be dedicated fans of
Michael

, bought the property in Highgate, north London, from the singer’s family in 2020. The couple have now been granted permission from Camden council for a new basement that includes living accommodation and a second kitchen, The Sun has reported. Michael died in 2016.
They have also been allowed to extend
Charlotte Wace

article.label: UK news
article.shortHeadline: New owners of George Michael home win fight over makeover
